meanings.definition: To provide (an arrow) with feathers for flight.
meanings.sent1: She carefully fletches each arrow before going hunting.
meanings.sent2: The skilled archer knows how to fletch arrows for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy archer accidentally fletched the arrow backwards!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like arrows fletched with truth, hitting their mark.
meanings.sent5: The ancient craftsman taught his apprentice how to fletch with precision.

meanings.definition: A feather or group of feathers on an arrow.
meanings.sent1: The colorful fletch on the arrow helped it fly straight.
meanings.sent2: He admired the intricate design of the fletch on the arrow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole the fletch from the archer's arrows.
meanings.sent4: Her hat was adorned with a fletch of vibrant feathers.
meanings.sent5: The fletch on the arrow shimmered in the sunlight as it soared through the air.
